The main problem with this product is that it is overpriced and completely unnecessary. Lip exfoliation is one of the simplest, most inexpensive beauty routines one can engage in at home because it only requires two basic ingredients that virtually every household has on hand: sugar and oil. Specifically, all that is required to exfoliate the lips is a tiny amount of granular sugar, either white table sugar (sucrose as in this product), brown sugar, raw sugar, or sugar alcohol such as xylitol. Add to that an equal amount of any food-grade oil you have on hand in the house, for example: olive oil, canola oil, safflower oil, or coconut oil. One-fourth teaspoon each of granular sugar and oil is enough to do both lips. The instructions for do-it-yourself exfoliation are as follows: In a small bowl or saucer, measure out one-fourth teaspoon of granular sugar. On top of it put an equal amount of oil. Wash your hands and dry them thoroughly. Blend the sugar and oil together with the tip of your finger. Rub the sugar-oil mixture onto your lips in a circular motion for two-five minutes. Gently scrub off the mixture with a clean, damp washcloth to remove not only the sugar and oil, but any loosened, dead skin. If flaking, dead skin still remains on your lips, rub more of the sugar-oil mixture onto your lips and repeat the above process. After you are finished, immediately moisturize your lips, ideally with a natural, food-grade oil or a lip balm made with an oil-beeswax mixture, since anything that goes on the lips ultimately ends up in the mouth and stomach. The second problem with this product is that even though the container looks small, there is enough of this product to last a very long time. And while it is sitting on your bathroom shelf, it is slowly drying out. Within six months to a year, long before you've used more than a fraction of it, this product will deteriorate into a hard, unusable lump (not to mention that most cosmetics companies recommend throwing out their products anyway within six to nine months because of inevitable bacteria buildup). If you make your own sugar-oil mixture each time you need it, nothing is wasted, and it is always fresh, with a smooth, viscous consistency that glides onto your lips. The third problem with this product is that, though some of the ingredients are natural and food-grade, others are not. The ingredients for this product include: "Sucrose, Petrolatum, Flavor, Caramel, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, VitiVinifera (Grape) Seed Oil." Below is a description of each ingredient. The most problematic one is petrolatum. It is too bad that the makers of this product didn't just stick to grapeseed oil, which is a natural, healthy oil. Sucrose is simple white/table sugar. Petrolatum: This lab-derived substance has been around since 1859 when chemist Robert Chesebrough developed a method of purifying a black gel that clogged oil rigs called "rod wax." This is a very thick substance which is anything but ideal for exfoliating the skin. Flavor: It is not specified whether this is "artificial" or "natural" flavor. Artificial flavor is derived from non-food substances, that is, chemicals created in a lab. Natural flavor is derived from a real food, but the process by which it is derived is unexplained. In both cases, there is no way to know how safe or healthy the flavoring is. Caramel: This is sugar or syrup heated until it turns brown. It can either be used as a coloring agent or to impart flavor. Jojoba oil is a natural plant oil. It is created from the liquid wax of the seed of the jojoba plant, a shrub which is native to southern Arizona, southern California, and northwestern Mexico. It's much healthier than petrolatum, but it contains 14% erucic acid, which is not recommended to be taken internally. Grapeseed oil is a natural oil derived from the seeds of grape. It contains vitamin E and antioxidants.

The main problem with this product is that it is overpriced and completely unnecessary. Lip exfoliation is one of the simplest, most inexpensive beauty routines one can engage in at home because it only requires two basic ingredients that virtually every household has on hand: sugar and oil. Specifically, all that is required to exfoliate the lips is a tiny amount of granular sugar, either white table sugar (sucrose as in this product), brown sugar, raw sugar, or sugar alcohol such as xylitol. Add to that an equal amount of any food-grade oil you have on hand in the house, for example: olive oil, canola oil, safflower oil, or coconut oil. One-fourth teaspoon each of granular sugar and oil is enough to do both lips. The instructions for do-it-yourself exfoliation are as follows: In a small bowl or saucer, measure out one-fourth teaspoon of granular sugar. On top of it put an equal amount of oil. Wash your hands and dry them thoroughly. Blend the sugar and oil together with the tip of your finger. Rub the sugar-oil mixture onto your lips in a circular motion for two-five minutes. Gently scrub off the mixture with a clean, damp washcloth to remove not only the sugar and oil, but any loosened, dead skin. If flaking, dead skin still remains on your lips, rub more of the sugar-oil mixture onto your lips and repeat the above process. After you are finished, immediately moisturize your lips, ideally with a natural, food-grade oil or a lip balm made with an oil-beeswax mixture, since anything that goes on the lips ultimately ends up in the mouth and stomach. The second problem with this product is that even though the container looks small, there is enough of this product to last a very long time. And while it is sitting on your bathroom shelf, it is slowly drying out. Within six months to a year, long before you've used more than a fraction of it, this product will deteriorate into a hard, unusable lump (not to mention that most cosmetics companies recommend throwing out their products anyway within six to nine months because of inevitable bacteria buildup). If you make your own sugar-oil mixture each time you need it, nothing is wasted, and it is always fresh, with a smooth, viscous consistency that glides onto your lips. The third problem with this product is that, though some of the ingredients are natural and food-grade, others are not. The ingredients for this product include: "Sucrose, Petrolatum, Flavor, Caramel, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, VitiVinifera (Grape) Seed Oil." Below is a description of each ingredient. The most problematic one is petrolatum. It is too bad that the makers of this product didn't just stick to grapeseed oil, which is a natural, healthy oil. Sucrose is simple white/table sugar. Petrolatum: This lab-derived substance has been around since 1859 when chemist Robert Chesebrough developed a method of purifying a black gel that clogged oil rigs called "rod wax." This is a very thick substance which is anything but ideal for exfoliating the skin. Flavor: It is not specified whether this is "artificial" or "natural" flavor. Artificial flavor is derived from non-food substances, that is, chemicals created in a lab. Natural flavor is derived from a real food, but the process by which it is derived is unexplained. In both cases, there is no way to know how safe or healthy the flavoring is. Caramel: This is sugar or syrup heated until it turns brown. It can either be used as a coloring agent or to impart flavor. Jojoba oil is a natural plant oil. It is created from the liquid wax of the seed of the jojoba plant, a shrub which is native to southern Arizona, southern California, and northwestern Mexico. It's much healthier than petrolatum, but it contains 14% erucic acid, which is not recommended to be taken internally. Grapeseed oil is a natural oil derived from the seeds of grape. It contains vitamin E and antioxidants.

I bought this a month ago without doing much research, which was my bad. I did not know about the buffering lotion. If you have deep pimples, or cystic acne, the buffering lotion is the one for you. This drying lotion is good for white hides and smaller bumps, but not those deep, painful breakouts! I used this on my cystic acne not knowing any better, and it only made it worse. I figured maybe that was part of the process, that the breakouts needed to come to the surface first before clearing up, but nope! It just made them more inflamed. I have seen no improvement. This worked well on the smaller bumps, though. I will now be trying the buffering lotion, and will update this in a week or two.

EDIT: After a few months of using both the buffering and drying lotion, I prefer the buffering lotion for my cystic acne and always run to it whenever I notice a breakout coming along

*Update* I put a lot of this product on my legs tonight after showering and walked aroudn for about 20 minutes without pants to make sure it was dried. I then put on jeans and it felt fine - but the stench from the product is bothersome. It is like every other tanning product I've tried. I am not sure why it seems so much stronger that when I've used it in the past - it could be that I applied more than I usually do, or because i applied and put jeans on vs a skirt or loose, lightweight, summer pants during past applications. Whatever the case, it's giving me a headache and is quite strong. I'm not removing a star because the product still works well, and is really no different from other products in having the tell tale self-tanning cream odor. Original post: This is the second product by this brand that I've tried thru Vine. The first was Vita Liberata Phenomenal 2-3 Week Tinted Tan Mousse, Medium, 4.22 fl. oz. This is almost as good. The Mousse had no scent; this has a mild scent but I'm not sure what it is. It is very faint and doesn't smell anything like the typical self-tanning products (from drug store version to high end version, they all have a tell tale scent.) After an hour or so, the scent seemed a bit stronger, but was still mild compared with the typical self tanner scent and certainly wasn't enough to make me self conscious. I tested on my forearms and hands, and after about 3-4 hours, my skin had a nice, fresh glow. The product itself is white, a mix between a rich, thick cream and a lotion that easily blends into the skin. It dries fairly quickly; the first application I used a bit too much on my right arm and it took longer to dry fully to the touch (around 30 min.) I was more careful with my left arm and used half the amount - about 1.5 dime size of product on the second arm. It blends easily, but no matter what product I use or how careful I am, I always have at least a few streaks. The streaks this time were on my fingers, which is always a hard area to cover to ensure you get the backs but not fronts of the fingers. The second application helped to easily cover up my streaks. All in all, I really like that this is easy to use with very minimal scent and it delivers a rich glow pretty quickly.

Product smells very similar to old spice, but not as strong.  The scent lasts about 3-4 hours and seems to diminish exponentially after that.  It really does not feel like you have any deodorant on after 5 hours.  For the price, I would expect a more unique scent that would last longer than most deodorants I would find at the store for $5.  If you like the smell of old spice, I recommend just sticking with that as you get the same scent and longer protection.
Only selling point I see for this is the organic label on front if that is of particular interest.  Per the back:  98.94% ingredients are from natural origin and 20.11% from organic farming.

I bought this a month ago without doing much research, which was my bad. I did not know about the buffering lotion. If you have deep pimples, or cystic acne, the buffering lotion is the one for you. This drying lotion is good for white hides and smaller bumps, but not those deep, painful breakouts! I used this on my cystic acne not knowing any better, and it only made it worse. I figured maybe that was part of the process, that the breakouts needed to come to the surface first before clearing up, but nope! It just made them more inflamed. I have seen no improvement. This worked well on the smaller bumps, though. I will now be trying the buffering lotion, and will update this in a week or two.

EDIT: After a few months of using both the buffering and drying lotion, I prefer the buffering lotion for my cystic acne and always run to it whenever I notice a breakout coming along

My first introduction to Crabtree & Evelyn was in 2006, when I bought the old white colored metal tube of Rosewater that requires the key to empty the tube. I love this scent and have always used it sparingly, as a luxury item. My coworker "borrowed" it and used over half the tube this year, so I had to replenish my stock. I bought the new packaging tube, which makes the rose on the front look pixelated, and does not tell the story of the Rosewater fragrance. I dislike the cheap tube, and noticed the product is less solid than the old one I still have. It's not runny, but clearly the company is cutting corners on packaging and source materials. The lotion itself is still delightfully fragrant, smooth and goes on like silk.

When I opened the package I was so dubious I came to the site to verify the packaging looks like this on the site. It's still great, but I can tell the difference in the solidity of the cream; though the packaging is poor, it is what inside that counts.

I love the scent and will continue to buy it, but I feel embarrassed to display this cheap-looking tube at work, and would rather take the age-defying hand remedy in to work, since the packaging is less flimsy. I hope Crabtree and Evelyn will improve the packaging and keep up the quality of the product. I also wonder what chemicals are in the plastic tubing that are not in the metal tubes.

There are so many warnings and tips with Retinol that at first I hesitated thinking, I need a plain moisturizer. What magic beans are IN here?

I was looking only for a good quality, non-greasy lotion for dry skin, so I cannot attest to its ability to remove wrinkles and make me look like a beautiful 70 year old again. () Ive used the lotion regularly for about a month or more and my skin itches much less than it did. I have not applied this to my face but my hands, arms, elbows, and shoulders are definately more... supple. Smooth.

But most of all they don't itch.

At the same time my 82 year old mother used it with me. She applied to her face as well as limbs. I wish I could say that she looks younger; that wrinkles have disappeared but I honestly don't see a difference. However she FEELS better. She seems to believe there are fewer lines and dry spots and isn't that whats important?

Make sure you know what Retinol is before you commit to this. By comparison shopping it looks like this is a decent price and where some would find this an extraordinary even ludicrous purchase others would say that if you're going to spend money then theres no better reason to spend it than to make yourself feel good.

The entire liquor industry is based on this premise. The difference? Retinol Complex .5 is GOOD for you. But let me say that calling this age defense plays on some of our vulnerabilities and feels a little like manipulative marketing.

Its still a good lotion.

I am pleased to say that the product is not causing any skin irritation or discomfort but at the same time it is not really producing any noticeable results. One tiny vial container contains enough activator fluid for mere one application with the included pure marine algae Eye Masks. These eye masks are very fragile and tends to tear and break apart when you pour in the activator fluid. In the end the areas around the eyes does feel hydrated but nothing spectacular improvement that was noticeable with the suggested 10 mins.

Having said, The main reason for using the included pure marine algae Eye Masks is to apply the applicator fluid without using cotton based puffs which may contain pesticides that causes skin irritation but this also causes a lot of wastage of the applicator fluid since it drips and causing a messy waste since you are doing it at home alone and not in a professional SPA where someone else applies this for you while you lie down and sleep.

What I have discovered is that the applicator fluid is good for the skin around your eyes. It does make skin softer and feels well moisturized. Does this remove the black circle marks around the eyes - Maybe but that means you need to keep spending a lot of money and wasting a lot of these applicator fluid & pure marine algae Eye Masks each time you use them.

Instead I suggest that to make most use of this package and the six tiny vial containers by applying the applicator fluid directly around the skin of your eyes by your index finger just enough to moisten before you go to sleep every night and you will find positive improvement around your eyes. Not only because you are not wasting the applicator fluid but also long time application for 2-3 weeks every night does make the skin clear, tight and rejuvenated.

For the price & wastage of applicator fluid and messy difficult to use algae Eye Masks I am forced to rate this with two stars. Otherwise the product does not cause any harm to you other than raising eyebrows looking at the price-tag :)

***************** Original Review below **************************************************
I use hair spray every single day and I have been trying to find a single good brand that does the job off my current two brands. I have settled on Suave for the days when I am outside with the horses in the wind, dust and humidity simply because it is inexpensive and my hair stays put. But the trade off is I can't run a brush through my hair after spraying it and it can get dry in the summer. My second option has been Fekkai brand which is excellent, smells pretty, and holds well, yet feels soft & I can brush my hair and it still looks great. But....Fekkai is outrageously overpriced and hard to justify & the nozzles don't always work.

This CHI Keratin has a mild and not unpleasant scent, sprays out in a wide, fine mist and doesn't feel sticky. My hair feels soft and looks nice - the same way it does with the Fekkai and I can brush it for touch ups. If I use a bit more than when I use the Suave, I get a similar strong hold in a wind outside and humidity. On a normal day or if I am going to be inside only, a light spritz of the CHI is all I need. So I think I may have finally found my combination hair spray that does what both the others did all in one.

I really don't think this is doing much for me.  It's kind of a fun product to use because of the colors (green, with black kiwi seeds) and texture (very light and almost whipped) but I'm just not seeing the results I expect.

Part of the problem is that the exfoliating particles (the seeds, presumably) are not very dense in this product.  You can feel them going over your skin and if there were more of them, I think my opinion of this product would be different.  But as it is now, a large percentage of your skin is never going to come into contact with one of the seeds as you use this, so most of your skin will not be exfoliated.  Since this is marketed as a scrub, that's a problem.

This is gentle and non-irritating when used a few times a week.  If you have sensitive skin and have had trouble with microdermabrasion-type scrubs, this could still work for you.  Please note that it has alpha hydroxy acids and so should be used in combination with a sunscreen.  It does rinse off cleanly and without leaving residue, as well.

For what it's worth, I'm having more breakouts with this than before I used it.  I don't necessarily think it is causing the breakouts, but the less-effective exfoliation (as opposed to my previous scrub product) is slowing turnover of my skin cells, which is what's causing my problems.

In the end, this may be worth a try if you have really sensitive skin.  Otherwise, I'd look for a different product.  (Please note: you can read the full ingredients list in the product images.)

I bought this because I used to get a lot of razor bumps. I have a heavy beard and I have to do 2-3 passes to do a decent job of shaving.
Unfortunately my experience has NOT been as good as popular opinion so far. In fact, I pretty much skip the shave oil completely now-a-days. Here are more specific points:

1. The difference in shave quality with or without the shave oil is hardly noticeable to me
2. In light of the above, applying shave oil is the equivalent throwing away a minute or so every time
3. I try to be very careful and rinse the blades of my razor thoroughly after each shave to get the oil off them so that my blades will last longer. Unfortunately, I always tend to find some residual oil on the blades which - in my opinion - contributes to dulling the blades sooner than otherwise

I have used Strivectin three times a day for about three years. Being 45, I would have appreciated the disappearance of some lines or wrinkles.  However, there is absolutely no change in them with Strivectin. I find the claims to be bogus and I'm glad the FDA has been investigating them.

On the other hand, this moisturizer feels better on my skin than any other I've used. I love the feeling of it! Peppermint is what makes it feel cool but apart from that it is wonderfully thick and luscious on the skin without being sticky or oily.  Of course, there are probably moisturizers for a quarter of the cost that feel just as good. The problem is that most moisturizers are for women and contain scents that are supposed to appeal to women (although I cannot imagine how they would). Strivectin does not contain strong scent so it is suitable for men to wear.

Therefore I give this 0/5 stars for doing what it says it does - because the claims made for the product are bogus based on my experience. I give this product 2/5 for being a good men's moisturizer but it is way too expensive for a mere moisturizer so cannot be rated more highly than 2/5.

The Lip Slip is the only product currently in this last category (I stopped testing when it worked) - I love it.  I may buy a case to be sure I never run out...  I only need to apply a few times during the day (when I wake up / go to bed, after eating), and my lips no longer peel or feel like they will split apart.  Did I say I love this product?

First of all, I agree with all the reviewers who have written that it hurts.  It does.  But if you have unsightly hairs that you want gone it's worth the pain and it works.  I've dealt with female facial hair for about twenty years and while electrolysis did the trick for a while it was expensive and after years of treatments I decided to try something else.  I was hesitant to buy the Tria laser but finally caved; I became tired of all the plucking and the scabs that tweezers caused.  I ignored the instructions (probably not advisable) and used the Tria at the highest pulse possible once a week and the results are amazing.  I no longer have stubbly chin hairs that need everyday plucking, my skin feels SMOOTH, and while coarse white hairs do remain the Tria isn't supposed to target them to begin with.  It does smart so if you have a low tolerance for pain it's most likely not for you but if you're anything like I am and are sick of dark facial hair... well, I'm thrilled that I bought this product.

I bought ColorWow bc it states it's waterproof and I was going on a beach vacation. It did seem to hold up to the pool. ColorWow is a bit tedious to apply as its like an eyeshadow and you have to go over some places several times. Even then the silver is what I'd call faded not completely concealed. But, from a distance, it looks ok. Depends on how much of a secret you want your roots to be!  Also, having to use the brush to go over hair several times means it frizzed my roots a bit. Worst part of ColorWow is it transfers to your hands esp fingernails if you touch your hair. I didn't realize how much I touch my hair until this product. After a while, it made me look forward to washing it out. To help others on their quest, I'll note that I've tried two other products. ColorMark, which is like a marker, is ok but after applying enough to cover silver in some spots it got a bit cakey. So so coverage otherwise and time consuming. For me the first thing I bought at Bed Bath and Beyond, EverPro Gray Away, which is what I call a colored hairspray is the easiest and provides best coverage. Not sure of color match if my hair wasn't dark brown/black. But works best for me without grit or cake build up, quick application, and fairly full coverage. Negative would be applying close to temples/along face line as it is a spray so control isn't easiest. Still, washing my hands once after using them as a shield between hair and face, it's my go to.

I have no problem spending obscene amounts of money on skin care products in search of that Fountain of Youth. So far I have been pretty disappointed. This product has gotten some pretty high level reviews and after careful consideration I purchased it. The packaging was legit, it was sealed, taped up and indisputably the authentic deal. It seems like some people have been getting questionable products out there. I was prepared to be bowled over by an ungodly stench, but it smells gourd-like, like a fermenting melon, not too bad.

I'm definitely noticing my skin aging, loss of elasticity, enlarged pores, inability to retain moisture. I've purchased and used expensive products like La Mer, Shiseido even straight vaseline. I started using this a few weeks ago. I can't properly describe the effect, but after putting it on, a bit of a tingle or sting usually accompanies it, but my skin feels protected by it. It seems to stay on the surface, and it feels binding. My skin looks smoother, plumper and seems to appear more wholesome. I don't know if that makes sense, but I like the way it feels. I don't know if the effects are lasting, but I'll continue to use it up and if my skin retains a more youthful appearance then I'll definitely buy more.

I know some people are opposed to the ingredients, but seriously, cosmetics have a notorious past of blinding bunnies and torturing kittens. If this indeed is produced from the by products of circumcision then I'm glad some good can come of it. That is a procedure decided upon by parents, not aestheticians, anyways, placenta has long been used by hospitals to heal wounds and hasten healing. If you are morally opposed then do your research and make your own decision. I think this seems like a beneficial product and if I still like it in a few months then I may have found my magical Fountain of Youth product after all!

A friend recommended I try MenScience Androceuticals Advanced Deodorant, 2.6 oz.. It's marketed more for odor prevention and elimination, and I was extremely skeptical that it would work for me. I've had a serious problem with underarm sweating for years, and I've tried numerous brands of antiperspirants, even going as far to get the liquid prescription kind from my physician. There was a point a couple years ago when nothing could keep my dry. I even looked into Botox treatments for the underarms, which stop perspiration. I used to sweat through undershirts and dress shirts while sitting at my desk in a climate-controlled environment. Now, that doesn't happen. I'm not sure if my body had "gotten used to" the aluminum in other products or whether I was applying way too much of it. But this product, MenScience Androceuticals Advanced Deodorant, 2.6 oz., has really changed my life in some meaningful ways. When I started using the MenScience product, I stopped sweating from my underarms the way I used to. Now, I rarely ever sweat through my clothes and never encounter any odor. This is important to me because of the embarrassment and anxiety the sweating caused. Even better, I'm saving money since I don't have to toss out undershirts and pricey men's dress shirts as regularly. This had been a major frustration previously. I can't say how impressed I have been by what MenScience Androceuticals Advanced Deodorant, 2.6 oz. has accomplished for me without all the chemicals found in virtually every other product I've ever used.

I purchased this dryer about 90 days ago.  Its a great dryer- one of the best I have used.  I normally use Solano and other high end professional brands.  After 90 days of use, the concentrator nozzle has not been staying on.  It appears that the heat from use has caused the concentrator nozzle to lose its grip somehow.  For those of you with long, naturally curly/wavy hair, you understand how critical the concentrator nozzle is when straightening your hair.  My nozzle is now useless.  I called Babyliss Customer service off their website.  The girl I talked to said that Conair (parent company) doesn't carry concentrator nozzles for their professional brands, only the consumer Conair brand.  I was surprised at this, so I confirmed.  Yes- that is correct, we don't carry them and they are not covered under the warranty as a replacement part.  So I said and I quote " So what you are telling me, is that if one of your customers  purchases a Babyliss blow dryer, and the concentrator nozzle stops working or breaks, that the consumer is out of luck, I have no options"  Her answer- "Yes, that is correct".  I checked to see if any of their Conair dryer nozzles will fit, they said NO.  My only option is to try and find a universal nozzle to fit, or buy another one.  Something to think about as you consider this brand of dryer.

The only comparable product to my JB balm was Urban Decay's Lip Love (the one with honey which is sadly discontinued). This is the only lip product I have that will actually heal my chapped lips and make them soft again. The scent is lovely and a little goes a long way. I wish I could get more product for the price, but it's the best that I have so far.

What did we every do before anonymous product reiews showed up on the web?

What did companies do before the internet when they wanted to discredit a product so their product would sell better?

I just love it when I find a product that has exemplary reviews and then some moron comes along and bashes it in their review.  They never fail to mention the name of a "better" product.  When this happens, I find that I am compelled to buy the product to see if the moron has any credibilty.

I will begin by saying that I have no connections to Jack Black at all.  I do use a few of their products.  I was a huge fan of almost anything made by Zirh, but their three-step shaving system became just too time consuming.  That is when I heard about Jack Black's Beard Lube.  After trying it, I was converted.  I got the same shave with much less fuss and it cut my shaving time by at least 5 minutes.

I still use Zirh face products like Correct, Protect and Defend.  They are exceptional.  The Jack Black face scrub is painful.

Anyway, even though I have not run out of my current supply of Beard Lube, I ordered this Shave Cream.  I used it for the first time about 30 minutes ago.  This stuff is REMARKABLE!  It takes a bit more effort to apply than Beard Lube (I do not own $200 shaving brushes) but I worked up a good lather with just my fingers.  As soon as I began to move the razor against my skin, I actually had to stop because I thought I had forgotten to install a blade.  We are talking about an entire weekend's worth of stubble and the blade went through it with no pulling of any kind.  Without exaggerating one iota, this was the closest, cleanest, most comfortable shave I have ever had.

Rest assured readers, if you are considering this product, BUY IT!  You will not be sorry.

As for the moron, well, I cannot help you.  I hope you spent the $10.00 you got paid to post your review for something worthwhile.

First, I meant to order the 1" curling iron so I'm going to give you the approximate circumference of the 3/4" one which is 2 7/8".  When I hold the measuring tape up next to the barrel it measures 3/4".  My hairdresser cut my layers a tad too short last time so my mistake worked in my favor. I'd be burning myself quite often if I was using the 1" size.

I have a 1" Hot Tool curing iron, just like this one, that I've been using for over 6 years. My husband replaced the plug once because I had to keep wiggling the cord & plug to get everything in the proper place for the curling iron to stay on. Recently I began having problems with the cord again, but this time it's where the cord attaches to the handle & that is why I was ordering another curling iron. This new design is supposed to prevent that problem...only time will tell. I will update my review if necessary.

These irons come with two extra springs...I didn't have to use the extra springs with my old one, but I'm very happy the extras are included. (We've had to replace the springs in other curling irons I've owned through the years. It was never easy to find a replacement spring). The temperature settings/numbers eventually wore off of my old one & I'm expecting this one to do the same because they're applied in the same manner. I have a favorite setting.  I marked my old one with a silver permanent marker so I'd know which setting to use. Although these curling irons get very, very hot I do not & will not use the higher settings. For goodness sakes, my hair isn't made from asbestos. FYI: My hairdresser recently burned a section of my hair off when her curling iron was set too hot. Thankfully, it was in a hidden spot, I don't have long layers, and I was able to cover the burned off hair until it grew back. Anyway, let that be a warning to you...it can happen. I've used curling irons for years & years & years & that was a first for me & my hairdresser.  I use the #7 temperature. It's the first setting on the 'Extra Hot' category. My baby fine hair is extremely hard to curl. If this curling iron lives up to its predecessor, I can expect many more useful years out of it.  And, soon, I will be placing an order for the 1" size.

Great curling iron!

Hampton Sun SPF 15 Tanning Gel is in a very attractive container. It looks quite posh, for this type of product. Really it does. I thought it would be nice to give it a try, as I do a fair amount of gardening, and I walk to work and spend time outdoors. I like a wee bit of tan on my face in the summer. Why buy bronzer when you can get it for free, right? Now, on a particularly hot and sunny day I would want a product with a higher SPF. But since most of my outdoor forays are early in the morning, or fairly brief, I rarely feel the need for the high SPF products. This seemed like it might be a nice product to try.

I cannot say definitively if this actually works or not. I have a wee bit of color on my face, as I do every year at this time. I don't know if Hampton Sun SPF 15 Tanning Gel has protected me, or helped in any way. But it feels nice to apply,and is very light. And it is very posh looking, so if that matters to you, I say go for it. If you don't mind a multi-colored tube, that might be a better choice.

This is the only curling Iron I've ever used.. the very first one I bought was 8 years ago and lasted me about 4 years.. before the inside hinge broke off.. I bought another and I suppose they had by then been updated with the 360* rotating cord so no it doesn't twist and tangle.. ever since they have easily broken within months..twice the little black thumb grip broke off.. then the rotating cord stopped working (like it somehow disconnects the actual cord from the rest of the wand so there's no power.. this was the last one I bought (bringing me to a total of 4 AFTER my first one) and from day #2 of using it the rotating cord once again was causing the power to go out.. it turns on for the most part.. but as soon as the bottom turns with the movement the light goes out.. and if I'm not watching it consistently to make sure the light is still on.. I end up losing the heat and having to wait.. I have more hair than Mofasa, curlier than a cabbage patch kid and with the very first one I got (without the rotating cord) it would take me about 10 minutes to do my hair, it was amazing.. ever since they changed the model, besides breaking as easily as I just stated, they don't heat the same either.. it takes me longer to get to the highest setting and it takes about 3-5 slides through my hair to set the curl properly instead of just 1 (with the old model).. I don't know if they changed the actual metal piece, but they must have for a cheaper version because like I said, it used to heat in about 40 seconds and flatten my hair with one slide.. not I'm lucky if I'm done with my hair in under 30 minutes..

I've been using green color correctors for over 10 years, now, and I've tried all sorts of brands and various types of applicators/forms of it. I swear by it on my red spots, because it evens out my tone pretty magically, and who doesn't want an even skin tone? With so many cheaper brands/options available, I was a little hesitant to give this one a shot ($20 for this tiny tube, compared to the various drugstore brands that you can pick up for less than $10?). After some consideration, I figured it may be worth it, if it's better for my skin, and ordered one. Here's what I found: 1. It's NOT easy to apply. The consistency is.. odd. Coming out of the tube, it's a mixture of thick/thin, and you will quickly find that as you apply it, you have to struggle with it acting exactly the same on your face - thick on some parts, thin on others. 2. Even with primer on your face (I use LORAC POREfection Mattifying Face Primer, 1.7 fl. oz.), it just doesn't blend the way you'd hope it would. I often find myself rubbing the hell out of some spots, where it kind of "clumps up" and creates spots of pale green. 3. It dries SO QUICKLY. I keep having to dab it on and rub it around, like I'm on some kind of game show and the timer is running out. Nobody needs that kind of stress at 7am. 4. When you do get it on decently, it does color correct. I'll give it that. Would I pay $20 for another tube? Pass. If my review has helped you in any way, please let me know, or hit "Yes" under this review. Thank you! :)

The glue holds up really well all day. I used this a couple of times to put on some lashes for costumes.  It held up the entire time I needed it to(about six to eight hours).  I'm betting it would keep my lashes on for at least ten hours minimum.  It took a few minutes to get them off. I have only two complaints, the first is that the tube sucks.  They need to figure out a better method to store the glue.  I had a hard time getting the glue to come out and then is squirted all over the lashes.  This happened multiple times, luckily I caught on quick and I was careful to not squeeze it near my lashes again.  My second complaint is how little glue you get.  It's nice and purse size, but for the price and the amount of glue you lose when it gets everywhere I'm very disappointed.  I'll still probably buy it again because I like the ingredients, but if I had another vegan not-tested on animals option I might switch.

This dryer replaced my worn out CHI and was purchased at the recommendation of my stylist. I purchased a cheaper dryer after the CHI and before this one that didn't have the Ionic feature and it was amazing the damage to my hair after just 2 weeks of using it; I will never have a dryer without it again.  I am still getting used to the button placements on the new dryer being on the side of the handle, but it's not a problem.  Overall, a great dryer especially for the price.

Before ordering this product I was unfamiliar with the Japonesque brand. I'm pretty minimalist when it comes to makeup (my go-to is tinted moisturizer and loose powder). Per the product description, "This innovative light-reflecting liquid glides on to refresh the skin and enhance the complexion's natural glow -- creating a beautiful shimmering incandescence." I was excited about a product that would enhance my natural skin tone without caking on a bunch of heavy makeup. Unfortunately this product fell short of my expectations.

My single largest gripe is the color: this product can be best described as an orange-inspired metallic bronze. Considering the purpose of the product, I thought perhaps the orange hue would fade into my skin tone when applied (which is classified as medium with orange undertones). Sadly, it doesn't. I applied it to one side of my face and the orange hue completely took over and never really blended in.

All in all it just wasn't for me. Perhaps someone with a deeper skin tone with more orange undertones could appreciate this shade more than I did.

Let me say that other models of clarisonic brushes last much longer than these. The batteries in the alpha fit & mia fit 2 are terrible and usually don't last much past the warranty period.  However, these brushes can be fixed with a couple rechargeable AAA nimh batteries. Please keep in mind that doing this is at your own risk....
There is a rubber plug on the bottom of the brush that can be easily popped out with a small screw driver or other similar object. Once removed, there is a screw that needs to be removed. This will allow the brush to come apart. There is a little bit of adhesive between the plastic and metal ring. Take a small screw driver and gently go around too loosen the top. Don't pry or jab anything, as there is a gasket /o-ring and housing that can be damaged and ruin the water proofing. Scrape off the excess adhesive. Once once apart, note the position of the rubber band that goes around the internals. This band will probably shift when working on the unit, so you'll just want to make sure you get it or back in place before reassembly. Now you will need to cut the zip tie that holds the batteries in place(This won't come out until the batteries are removed). You can gently pry the metal clips off the batteries with needle nose pliers. This can take some time. If you rush and do not do it slow and gentle you will most likely break the metal clips. If the clips break, you will most likely need to solder replacement wires to the main board, as they will probably not be long enough to reach the batteries. I used a small piece of copper wire to solder the bottom of the new batteries (- to +). Don't use a thick wire on the bottom of the batteries, it is unnecessary and could  take up too much space, causing the batteries to not fit properly in the brush. Place the new batteries into position in the brush. You should be able to reuse the plastic wrap from the original batteries to the help keep them together. However, you can use some electrical tape as an alternative. Electrical tape can make a snug fit in the battery holder, which should hold them in place so you don't need to use new zip ties; I chose to put in new zip ties. Now, solder the positive & negative wires to the tops of the new batteries. Once done, put everything back together. You may want to add additional sealant to make sure it stays water tight. I added a small silicon layer to the top edge of the lower plastic casing. When putting back together the metal ring should meet this. Silicon will squeeze out. Wipe off any excess. Now put the screw and rubber cap back. You now have a working brush again.

The interesting thing about this product is that so many of its pros also wind up being cons.

For example: the texture of the cream is very light - some have called it almost gel-like, and I'd agree with that.  That lightness makes it easy to smooth on the face.  The downside to that: it's so light that it doesn't impart much moisture at all.  This would be great for someone who doesn't have particularly dry skin, but for those of us who need a big dose of moisture, this doesn't work for that.  For those who benefit from light moisturization, be prepared for how this product gives you that: in my experience, after it's smoothed on, it leaves a lightly tacky, even greasy feel to the skin.

The scent has gotten a lot of mentions in reviews, and there is a reason for that.  I thought it would be fine for me even though I'm very sensitive to strong aromas because "parfum/fragrance" is the last item on the ingredient list.  Initially, it seems to have a lovely, light rose scent.  However, that scent doesn't dissipate at all - it just sits there on your face, and for me, it became cloying and eventually overwhelming.  By the time I'd had it on for about a half hour, I'd begun to develop a headache and had to wash it off.  (Side note: it didn't come off easily at all with just water; this is the kind of product that requires some kind of cleanser to totally remove.)

The packaging is nice, in terms of the inside of the box having diagrams and instructions for application of the product, and the jar is quite pretty with a useful mirror serving as the top of the lid.  The downside here, though, is that this obviously requires you to dip your fingers into the product in order to then apply it to your face; as such, even with clean hands, eventually bacteria could start to be a concern, so I would have preferred if the cream had come in a pump-form.

The aspects of the product that don't have "cons" - it's paraben free, and even though my skin is highly sensitive, I didn't experience any irritation when I put this on my face.  (However, it is worth noting again that I could only tolerate having it on my skin for a half hour because of the fragrance.)

It's been so difficult - actually it's been impossible, thus far - for me to find a moisturizer/cream that won't irritate my sensitive skin and won't make my extreme sensitivity to fragrance come into play.  This product will likely work for people who don't have to deal with those things and don't require a product that delivers a lot of moisture.  For all of those like me who are on a quest for an effective, non-irritating, non-aggravating moisturizer, the search continues.

I have had Oribe products used on my hair before, while at the salon, and loved them.  Was willing to splurge on this product for the most divine scent I have ever smelled in a hair product, in addition to the high quality of Oribe's products.  First disappointment was that I must have selected the one Oribe product that smells like, well, wax.  No beautiful scents, supposedly originating from the same lab that Tom Ford concocted his amazing perfumes, for this product.  Additionally, I found the wax difficult to work with (i.e., really challenging to get it out of the container and spread throughout my palms without chunks of it falling on the floor).  Finally, I hated that it made my hair hard and crunchy once applied.  It held it alright, but I don't care for spiky hair.  I realize many people like a product that does this for them.  What can I say? This product would work for you.  And although it had maximum hold, I needed to wash my hair and restyle every day in order to have the product hold the same way it did upon first application.  I have really short hair and can go three days without washing and still have my hair look, smell and feel good.  I don't want to wash my hair every day and reapply product in order to style my hair the right way. After reading so many glowing reviews, I was excited to try this newer formulation of Proraso, only to be quite disappointed by it.

Pros:
  Good lather and a fairly lubricating shave.

Cons:
  Too firm---a bit waxy.  Falls off the brush and is a little difficult to start lathering.
  Fragrance: cheap white soap.  Clean & fresh,  but very uninteresting.  A bit of an off-smell, which the red formula has, too.
  No more "protective" or moisturizing than the other Proraso formulas.
  Just not as rich, lubricating & easy to use as the very original formula.

Having tried this and the red & newer green formulas, I am bidding the Proraso brand good-bye.  I may use the "White" soap in winter.

However, I still love C.O.Bigelow in the green tube, which is made by Proraso.  It is still creamy, incredibly easy to lather, rich, lubricating and soothing.  Fantastic cream, compared to this.  Menthol/Eucalyptus might not be for everyone, but I do enjoy it much more than these Proraso alternatives.

Possibly I got a bad lot, but I surely have far more enjoyable creams than this one.

I heard good things about this brand so thought I'd give it a try. I have been straightening my hair for about 12 years. When I was first introduced to a straightening believe me with my hair it was life changing. I have very thick wavy hair and have always wanted stick straight hair. Its so time saving being able to iron it and it stays that way until I wash it. My first iron was a professional one my hair dresser bought for me (ten yrs ago straighteners were hard to come by, good ones anyway) to date it was the best one I've ever had. Wish I could remember the name it was Italian. Anyway the FHI iron is not worth the money. I could have straightened it better with a curling iron. It made my hair look a little straighter but very fluffy! I have a cheaper Revlon brand iron that I got once in a bind and it works waaaaaaaaaaaaaaay better than this one. So a word to the wise don't waste your money. Chi is a better way to go. Same price range and you get a much better result. Good luck!!!!

To start off - my skin is oily with redness and large pores but I don't struggle with acne. This product may work better for someone with drier, acnaeic skin. My main goal with concealer is to cover redness, large pores, and acne scars on my cheeks.

You get a lot of product in the tube so I was really hoping it would be my new favorite concealer. Unfortunately it's difficult to apply as it doesn't really want to stick to skin. When I try to blend it it moves around and I end up having to use a ton to get it to stay in one place. If you can get it to stick where you want it, it settles into fine lines and doesn't do anything to cover large pores. It has a very dry, makeup-y finish so it's best to use it on very small areas. It may work well to cover pimples if you have acne but I think it would be very difficult to apply it to a pimple. If you have larger areas to conceal, this is not going to work for you.

I am a fan of Mario Badescu products. I have recommended them to clients with skin sensitivities and in most cases they have been very happy with their performance. Once in a while, however, I come across a product which I am not as fond of. This, unfortunately, happens to be one of them. WHAT IS THIS CLEANSER LIKE? A nice sized bottle, I do like the color of the cleanser. It reminds me of pistachio ice cream. The texture of the cleanser is very creamy and thick. It has tiny flecks of dark green in it which is the seaweed. The fragrance is a touch overwhelming for me, however. I am not sure what it is. It just is not a smell that I enjoy a whole lot. The label stays on and does not come off like Mario Badescu The Moisture Magnet SPF 15, 2 oz.. HOW DOES THIS CLEANSING SOAP PERFORM? A little goes along way of this stuff. It is thick and creamy and a delightful green color. The cream smears around on the skin nicely and when adding a little bit of water to it, it does foam up some, but is not really sudsy like some soaps can be. It does make skin soft at first, but then I feel as if the skin is too stripped. The time that I am testing this in is a time of humidity and more oiliness and this cleanser is stripping my skin already- in winter, I am thinking it will be way too much for me to use. I have normal to dry skin. I have had my daughter test it. She said it was nice at first but felt it stripped her skin a bit too much. In both cases, the skin surface felt smooth, although dry and tight. I have not had the men try it yet- they don't like to try new products. It is hard to pin them down. THE WORST PART- ITCHING The worst part about this cleanser is that it made our skin itch a bit. Perhaps it was from drying it out so much or maybe the sodium laureth sulfate it contains, but it just makes the skin feel uncomfortable. No matter how much lotion I apply, it does not seem to soothe this feeling entirely. THE BOTTOM LINE Great sized bottle, lovely texture and green color, this soap seemed promising. Creamy and easy to use without being overly foamy, I found the fragrance to be a bit overwhelming and it left our skin stripped and a bit itchy and uncomfortable and tight. I have given this one star. If you have very oily skin and perhaps don't mind it being a strong cleanser, then perhaps you would like it. For us, it really is rough on our skin and it just leaves us too uncomfortable to rate it higher than that.

After trying out the Merkur Futur I'm really disappointed - it really is overkill. I like the idea of an adjustable razor because I'm prone to cut myself in predictable places when shaving, and parts of my face are more "tender" than others. Other than the adjustability, there's not a lot I like about this razor. First and most important, it is too big, and it is needlessly overweight. The problem with the size is that the head is too big to have good control over margins around my beard. I have a goatee and when I tried to shave right up the edge of my beard, I can't see what I'm doing. The razor is so heavy that you have little feel for what is going on at the cutting edge.  I also have a Merkur 180 and when I finish shaving I like to loosen the head to blow out any residual water. I've found this greatly extends the life of the blade because most of the dulling of the blade comes from micro-oxidation (rust) and not from cutting the hair. To blow out water from the head of the Future, you have to completely pop the top off which causes the blade to want to jump dangerously out. I recommend the Merkur 180 over the Future because of size, weight and control over the instrument, not to mention the big difference in price. I'm going to continue to work with the Futur because it cost too much to just set it aside completely. I want to get my money's worth out of it. Most likely it will live in my travel kit.

I have used Sebastian Drench Moisturizing Shampoo and Conditioner faithfully for about 2 years now and I absolutely love it.  I normally purchase it in person from the salon I visit regularly.  My hair is always silky smooth and great smelling and therefore I have no qualms about paying the money I do for it 'cause frankly I think it's worth it.  About a month ago I ran out of my beloved Drench right before going on vacation.  Short on time to make the drive to my salon to purchase another bottle, I jumped on Amazon.com to take advantage of my prime membership perks (free 2 day shipping) and a slightly lower price.  I was estatic when I received my bottle of Drench but after using it for some time I noticed my hair felt dry, brittle and had a weird chemical smell equivalent to the smell of gasoline.  My hair became unmanagable, dull and lifeless.  It felt thick with buildup.  Not healthy and not shiny (what I'm used to with Drench).  Needless to say, I became very suspicious of the product I purchased online.  Even my scalp suffered horribly and become very tender and red.  I experienced a tingly, burning sensation after every use.  Well, last night I decided I had enough of this bottle and went into the salon to purchase my shampoo in person.  After washing my hair with this new bottle of Drench, my hair is back to smelling great, feeling silky smooth, looking shiny and feeling healthy.  I am 100% positive it was the shampoo I purchased online.  Just a word to the wise, if you read the guarantee on the bottle, it says it's only guaranteed when purchased from a licensed salon.  I am very skeptical that the product I bought here online is even legit.  After comparing the two bottles, I finally noticed the difference.  The bottle I purchased from the salon has a lot number/product number on the bottom of the bottle and the one I bought from Amazon does not.  Just be careful folks, I feel like I was sold a fake bottle of Sebastian Drench.  From no on, I'm purchasing Drench from my salon and I would advise you to do the same.

For the price I am disappointed. I use products, let it heat up to 20-30 mins then roll up my hair, let it set for another 30-40 mins depending on when i finish my makeup then spray hair spray again and then take them out. This set only gives you waves. With the smaller barrels it actually gives you curls, but they die within 10 mins..Yeah the finish look, looks like a mess! I would NOT be using this hot roller set if I wanted CURLS! They take forever to heat up, there's not enough clips, I've notice all the rollers on top get hotter than the ones at the bottom row, and for the price you would expect more but it's bs. Im only keeping this becuz I am new to hot rollers, want to style my hair everyday without using an actual iron that heats up to idk like 450 degrees. And despite the fact that it doesn't really give you curls at least my hair will still be style than that ugly plain straight hair I've got. P.s the clips might hold well but are so cheap. One broke on the first day I got them! I also bought the conair multiple set which is the hot pink one. It works SO MUCH better than this one! Takes less than 1 min to heat up and curls last ALL DAY!

Update 10/15/14
The other day I started using this hot roller set again. This time I let it heat up to an hour becuz my hair is very thick, mean while it's heating up I start spraying my hair with heat protector and strong finish sprays. When I am rolling up my hair, I actually take smaller sections and end up having like a million hot rollers in my hair, which looks ridiculous but is so fun at the same time and Im only at home so who cares! While they are settling in my hair, I take a lighter hair spray and use it all over. Wait a good 30-40 mins then I take them out. Soon as I finish taking them out I spray my hair with the strongest hairspray I have, and then shake/pick the curls out and one final last spray with a light one. They're actually not bad after using a s*** load of hairspray !

I have been a Ouidad user off and on for about 14 years.  After 2 years going the suflate/silicone free route, I started using silicones again.  I decided to give Ouidad another try as I always liked her Climate Control Gel.  Ouidad had a great deal on a set of Curl Quencher products that included an 8.5 oz bottle of the gel.  The gel is not great for me.  While it leaves hair very soft, it does not have enough hold.  My hair gets fluffy and poofy with it.  I get far better results with my $3.50 bottle of LA Looks Sports Gel.  I won't be repurchasing.

[Note: I also re-purchased the Climate Control Gel and that one really is great for my hair type.  I like it best when I add a touch of LA Looks Sports Gel (2 parts Climate Control to 1 part LA Looks Sports Gel) because I find that my curls look really defined that way.  Climate Control Gel by itself leaves me with stringlets.  For tightly coiled hair, Climate Control is the way to go.]

Have to revise my original review...iron doesn't get hot unless turned way up and is now causing damage to my hair.  Too late to return, so in the trash it goes!  Don't waste your money!

***I was worried at first when I read the reviews about the iron burning people's hair off.  However, I decided to chance it and give it a try since there were so many other positive reviews.  I'm glad I did.  So far I love this iron.  As long as you keep it at the right temperature for your hair type and test the heat before using, you shouldn't have an issues.  I noticed that the temperature dial can be easily bumped up to a higher temp if you're not careful, but knowing that just makes me pay attention to the heat.  I use this at the 300 temp setting and it puts beautiful, big waves in my fine,  color-treated hair.
Not worth the price. Hard to get out of the bottle without a pump and not hydrating. I love Davines but this is a dud.
Love the concept and the lightweight brush.  It doesn't get hot enough to straighten my curly hair.  I still have to flat iron afterwards.  If this were high wattage, it would be better.
Had trouble getting a good thick foam.

I've been using this serum for about a week now and I have found it to be effective. It is really smooth going on and it absorbs quickly into the skin. I like that you can put your daily moisturiser on over it and  feel confident that it has already penetrated your pores. To get the maximum benefit out of the serum, I apply it in the morning and the evening as well. I layer it with my toner then moisturizer, and then finally my retinoid, Tretinoin.

There is one negative thing I have to say, and I've seen other reviewers mention the same thing. And that is regarding a less than ideal pump dispenser. It is a little hard to press down and when you pump the dispenser, a lot of the product comes out. It is usually a lot more than needed, thus a waste of good serum. That is the only reason I have given a 4 star rating. I still have to consider whether I will repurchase it.  But only for the faulty pump dispenser.

Well, here is an update! I just finished the bottle of my serum. It is exactly 2 months since it arrived, and it's already gone. I started out the first week using it twice a day. When I realized that so much of the product was being wasted due to that faulty pump (the bottle is designed that way, not just mine), I started only using it in the morning. I figured that I had to conserve what I had remaining. Well, originally I gave a 4 star rating not 5 due only to that "problem." But I am going to change that rating to 2 stars because I am very upset that I purchased a product for that price and it's finished already. I'm wondering if they designed it that way on purpose. Either way, I won't purchase it again. There are many other serums out there that will do the same thing, but will last longer than two months. That, is disappointing!
It's alright nothing special

The shave itself is fine and I do like the smell and feel of the lotion.  I would never buy this.
